content:
What a great idea! A retro-themed playlist is a perfect accompaniment to your retro game night and photo booth. Here are some must-have retro songs to include on your playlist:

**50s and 60s:**

* Rock Around the Clock by Bill Haley and His Comets
* Great Balls of Fire by Jerry Lee Lewis
* La Bamba by Ritchie Valens
* I Want to Hold Your Hand by The Beatles
* Twist and Shout by The Beatles
* Surfin' U.S.A. by The Beach Boys
* Dancing in the Street by Martha and the Vandellas

**70s:**

* Stayin' Alive by the Bee Gees
* I Will Survive by Gloria Gaynor
* YMCA by the Village People
* American Woman by The Guess Who
* Sweet Emotion by Aerosmith
* Kung Fu Fighting by Carl Douglas
* Disco Inferno by The Trammps

**80s:**

* Don't Stop Believin' by Journey
* Sweet Child O' Mine by Guns N' Roses
* Like a Virgin by Madonna
* Total Eclipse of the Heart by Bonnie Tyler
* Footloose by Kenny Loggins
* Flashdance... What a Feeling by Irene Cara
* Hungry Like the Wolf by Duran Duran

**Retro Pop and Novelty:**

* Pac-Man Fever by Buckner & Garcia
* Space Invaders by The Pretenders
* The Safety Dance by Men Without Hats
* Take On Me by A-ha
* Walking on Sunshine by Katrina & The Waves
* Funkytown by Lipps Inc.

These songs are sure to get your guests singing along, dancing, and having a blast. You can also consider adding some retro TV and movie theme songs, like the themes from Happy Days, The Brady Bunch, or Star Wars, to add to the nostalgic vibe.

Remember to create a playlist with a good mix of fast and slow songs to keep the energy level up and give your guests a chance to catch their breath. You can also consider creating a playlist with retro video game sound effects and music to tie in with the game night theme.

Have fun creating your playlist, and I hope it helps make your retro game night and photo booth a huge success!
